intro: Senecio microbasis, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio microbasis is adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
